required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Persistence of Anti-meningococcal Bactericidal Antibodies Among Adolescents Who Previously Received MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate the Persistence Of Antibody Responses Among Adolescents Who Previously Received Novartis MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine or Commercially Available MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate the persistence of bactericidal antibodies in adolescents previously enrolled in the V59P13 study who received either Novartis MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine or commercially available MenACWY conjugate vaccine. The study will also enroll age-matched subjects who have never received any other meningococcal vaccine (naïve subjects) to serve as an additional control group.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With Human Complement Serum Bactericidal Activity (hSBA) Titers≥ 1:8, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Immune response of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to that of one dose of licensed comparator vaccine at 21 months, 3 years and 5 years after vaccination, as measured by the percentages of subjects with human complement serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) titers≥ 1:8 directed against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Titers≥ 1:4, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to that of one dose of licensed comparator vaccine at 21 months, 3 years and 5 years after vaccination, as measured by the percentages of subjects with hSBA titers≥ 1:4 against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs), After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to that of one dose of licensed comparator vaccine at 21 months, 3 years and 5 years after vaccination, as measured by the hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With No Previous Meningococcal Vaccination With hSBA Titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response of age-matched naive subjects with no previous meningococcal vaccination, as measured by the percentages of subjects with hSBA titers≥ 1:4, and ≥ 1:8 against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMT) in Subjects With No Previous Meningococcal Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response of age-matched subjects with no previous meningococcal vaccination, as measured by hSBA geometric mean titers (GMTs) against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 After a Booster Dose of MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Immune response at one month after one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who had previously received one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by percentages of subjects with hSBA Titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 in Subjects After One Dose of MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Persistence of immune response at two years following administration of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by hSBA titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence of hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) in Subjects After One Dose of MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Persistence of immune response at two years following administration of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by hSBA GMTs against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed as the number of subjects who had previously been vaccinated in the parent study with MenACWY-CRM or licensed comparator who reported solicited local and systemic adverse events within 7 days after the administration of a booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 year time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With New Medical Diagnoses of Chronic Diseases, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine or Licensed Comparator
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number of subjects with new diagnoses of chronic diseases, among subjects who had previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine or licensed comparator vaccine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Who Reported Medically Attended Adverse Events, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number of subjects with medically attended AEs within 28 days after vaccination with one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine.

arm_group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and were followed for persistence in the present study.

Subjects received one primary dose of a quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine with diphtheria toxoid as the protein carrier in the parent study and were followed for persistence in the present study at 5 years postvaccination.
Subjects who were age-matched to the other study groups and had not received any previous meningococcal vaccinations.
Subjects received one primary dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

Subjects received one primary dose of quadrivalent meningococcal diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

intervention.other_name: Quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine with diphtheria toxoid as the protein carrier

results_reference.citation: Gill CJ, Baxter R, Anemona A, Ciavarro G, Dull P. Persistence of immune responses after a single dose of Novartis meningococcal serogroup A, C, W-135 and Y CRM-197 conjugate vaccine (Menveo®) or Menactra® among healthy adolescents. Hum Vaccin. 2010 Nov;6(11):881-7. Epub 2010 Nov 1.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 19 sites in US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects were included in the trial.

outcome.title: Percentages of Subjects With Human Complement Serum Bactericidal Activity (hSBA) Titers≥ 1:8, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
outcome.description: Immune response of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine compared to that of one dose of licensed comparator vaccine at 21 months, 3 years and 5 years after vaccination, as measured by the percentages of subjects with human complement serum bactericidal activity (hSBA) titers≥ 1:8 directed against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PP persistence population - subjects who provided one evaluable serum sample at baseline at any visit (21 months, 3 years and 5 years) and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.population: Analysis was done on PP post booster persistence population - subjects who provided one evaluable serum sample at baseline at any visit (3 years and 5 years) and had no major protocol deviations.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM/MenACWY-CRM

group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of a quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine with diphtheria toxoid as the protein carrier in the parent study, and one booster dose of MenACWY- CRM conjugate vaccine in the present study at 3 years after primary vaccination.

outcome.description: Persistence of immune response at two years following administration of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by hSBA titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PP post booster persistence population - subjects who provided one evaluable serum sample at baseline at any visit (3 years and 5 years) and had no major protocol deviations.

group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of quadrivalent meningococcal diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

measure.title: Percentages of Subjects With hSBA Titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 in Subjects After One Dose of MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine
measure.description: Persistence of immune response at two years following administration of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by hSBA titers≥ 1:4 and ≥ 1:8 against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.
measure.population: Analysis was done on PP post booster persistence population - subjects who provided one evaluable serum sample at baseline at any visit (3 years and 5 years) and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Persistence of hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) in Subjects After One Dose of MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine
outcome.description: Persistence of immune response at two years following administration of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by hSBA GMTs against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PP post booster persistence population - subjects who provided one evaluable serum sample at baseline at any visit (3 years and 5 years) and had no major protocol deviations.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM/MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

group.title: Licensed Comparator /MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of quadrivalent meningococcal diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

measure.title: Persistence of hSBA Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) in Subjects After One Dose of MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine
measure.description: Persistence of immune response at two years following administration of one dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in subjects who previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine, as measured by hSBA GMTs against N meningitidis serogroups A, C, W and Y.
measure.population: Analysis was done on PP post booster persistence population - subjects who provided one evaluable serum sample at baseline at any visit (3 years and 5 years) and had no major protocol deviations.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events
outcome.description: Safety was assessed as the number of subjects who had previously been vaccinated in the parent study with MenACWY-CRM or licensed comparator who reported solicited local and systemic adverse events within 7 days after the administration of a booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 year time point.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the solicited safety dataset, i.e. the subjects in the exposed population who provided postvaccination safety data.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM/MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of the MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

group.title: Licensed Comparator /MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of quadrivalent meningococcal diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Local and Systemic Adverse Events
measure.description: Safety was assessed as the number of subjects who had previously been vaccinated in the parent study with MenACWY-CRM or licensed comparator who reported solicited local and systemic adverse events within 7 days after the administration of a booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 year time point.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the solicited safety dataset, i.e. the subjects in the exposed population who provided postvaccination safety data.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With New Medical Diagnoses of Chronic Diseases, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine or Licensed Comparator
outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number of subjects with new diagnoses of chronic diseases, among subjects who had previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine or licensed comparator vaccine.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on safety follow-up population - subjects enrolled at 5 years were included in the safety follow-up for 24 hours after blood draw and for analysis of medical history to identify new onset of chronic diseases.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and were followed for persistence in the present study.

group.title: Licensed Comparator
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of a quadrivalent meningococcal conjugate vaccine with diphtheria toxoid as the protein carrier in the parent study and were followed for persistence in the present study at 5 years postvaccination..

measure.title: Number of Subjects With New Medical Diagnoses of Chronic Diseases, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate Vaccine or Licensed Comparator
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number of subjects with new diagnoses of chronic diseases, among subjects who had previously received one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine or licensed comparator vaccine.
measure.population: Analysis was done on safety follow-up population - subjects enrolled at 5 years were included in the safety follow-up for 24 hours after blood draw and for analysis of medical history to identify new onset of chronic diseases.

class.title: Fact. influ. hlth stat & cont. with hlth ser- 21 M
Nervous system and sense organs - 21 Months
Nervous sys & sense organs-21 mths through 3 years
Nervous sys & sense organs-3 years through 5 years
Symptoms, signs and ill-defined conditions - 21 M

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Who Reported Medically Attended Adverse Events, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
outcome.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number of subjects with medically attended AEs within 28 days after vaccination with one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on safety population - subjects who received vaccination with MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine, provided post-baseline safety data and provide safety follow-up information for any period during the 28 day follow-up.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and were followed for persistence in the present study.

group.title: Licensed Comparator

group.description: Subjects who were age-matched to the other study groups and had not received any previous meningococcal vaccinations.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Who Reported Medically Attended Adverse Events, After One Dose of Either MenACWY-CRM Conjugate or Licensed Comparator Vaccine
measure.description: Safety was assessed in terms of number of subjects with medically attended AEs within 28 days after vaccination with one dose of either MenACWY-CRM conjugate or licensed comparator vaccine.
measure.population: Analysis was done on safety population - subjects who received vaccination with MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine, provided post-baseline safety data and provide safety follow-up information for any period during the 28 day follow-up.

class.title: Ear and Labyrinth Disorders- Cerumen Impaction

reported_events.time_frame: New medical diagnoses of chronic diseases in subjects who previously received MenACWY-CRM conjugate or Licensed comparator vaccine were collected from day 1 to 5 years. Medically attended AEs were collected within 28 days after vaccination at 5 years.
reported_events.desc: All SAEs reported during 24 hours from blood draw at the 5-year timepoint were collected.

group.title: MenACWY-CRM
group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine in the parent study and were followed for persistence in the present study.

group.title: Licensed Comparator

group.description: Subjects received one primary dose of quadrivalent meningococcal diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine in the parent study and one booster dose of MenACWY-CRM conjugate vaccine at 3 years after primary vaccination.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
